com.clarionmedia.infinitum.orm.sqlite

Class SqliteUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.clarionmedia.infinitum.orm.sqlite.SqliteUtils

  • public class SqliteUtils
extends java.lang.Object

    This class contains utility methods for generating SQL strings for a SQLite database.

    • Method Detail

      • getWhereClause

        public java.lang.String getWhereClause(java.lang.Object model,
                              SqliteMapper mapper)
                                throws InfinitumRuntimeException
        Generates a "where clause" String used for updating or deleting the given persistent Object in the database. Where conditions are indicated by primary key Field's. Note that the actual String "where" is not included with the resulting output.

        For example, passing an object of class Foobar which has a primary key foo with a value of 42 will result in the where clause foo = 42.

        Parameters:
        model - the model to generate the where clause for
        Returns:
        where clause String for specified Object
        Throws:
        InfinitumRuntimeException - if there is an error generating the SQL

      • getWhereClause

        public java.lang.String getWhereClause(java.lang.Class<?> c,
                              java.io.Serializable id,
                              SqliteMapper mapper)
                                throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Generates a "where clause" String used for the given persistent Class in the database with the given primary key. Where conditions are indicated by primary key Field's. Note that the actual String "where" is not included with the resulting output.

        For example, passing a Class Foobar which has a primary key foo with a value of 42 will result in the where clause foo = 42.

        Parameters:
        c - the Class of the model
        id - the primary key for the model
        Returns:
        where clause String for specified Class and primary key
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if there is a mismatch between the Class's primary key type and the type of the given primary key
